reviews.sentence: Great for 25 and under. Very party vibe and a great view on upper floors. Rooms are small need an update and just feel a little partied in. Gentlemans club two doors down. Like I said cool place for people looking to party but not really a kid friendly place. Staff very nice location great and a house car certain hours at no cost. Lots of cool lights everywhere.
Good stay. The staff was amazing and helpful. The housekeeping and the room cleaning not good they did not even bother to redo the bed linen.

Good location small rooms but modern. They were undergoing serious renovations when I last stayed but I did enjoy my room. Small corner rom but typical for SF. Easy check in process close to Mascone center quiet with all modern amenities and walkable to union square. I had go back without hesitation hopefully they will improve their unloading area that was the only part that was a bit confusing the lobby is very small to the right past the restaurant off the Main Street. My cab had difficulty figuring out where to go hopefully that is streamlined now.
Location is convenient. I primarily use this hotel for the spa which is nice. it is small and needs minor updating but the people and quality of the services are great.

good vibe close to union square. Nice lobby lounge style with DJ and atmosphere at night good for drinks dinner or grabbing a byte. Valet parking 64 per day very expensive since you are already paying a lot for a room. hotel in good condition very clean. Was expecting more for the hotel bathroom a better tile or modern look for me should be more updated for a W no black outs in the room so its very clear in the morning. the staff is really helpful and attentive. beds are comfortable. walking distance to union square and next to moma museum. love the decor on the elevator.

Worst Hotel Stay in Years. Words can not describe how disappointing this stay was. As a SPG Platinum member I am usually treated like a valued guest. Not here. The staff was rude the rooms need a refurbishing the shower has no pressure but most of all I hate being lied to. I was given the wrong bed type upon check in. I called to complain and was told that I would be given a King bed the next morning as soon as a guest checked out and the room was cleaned. I was told to wait for a call from the front desk Informing me that a room was ready. The call never came and I had to go down and ask what happened and explain what to a completely untrained employee exactly what was promised to me the night before. His initial answer there is no way anyone told you that. Worst of all however was that when I checked in I informed the front desk agent that I would. be staying only 3 nights and not 4. I explained to her that I had called earlier in the week to make this change and I was told at that time that it would not be a problem. Now at check in it still had me for 4 nights despite my earlier call. She told me that it would be no problem to change it and not to worry. Sure enough when I checked out I was told I was still booked for a 4th night and would have to pay an early departure fee equal to a full nights stay. You can be sure I will be disputing that with my credit card company. One thing for certain the W San Francisco will. never get my business again.

Maybe my company negotiated the cheapest tired rooms possible. Have not stayed at the W in several years. Was looking forward to visiting again for a business trip. Check in was friendly and efficient. The only room they had available was on a low floor in the back of the hotel. It looked like it had not been renovated nor thoroughly cleaned in a very long time. Sheets pillows appeared to be clean but had that thread bare grey tint indicating they had been extended past their shelf life. On a positive note room service was fast efficient and very good. In all fairness to the W my company has an annoying habit of negotiating the cheapest possible rooms in what are typically highly rated hotels see some of my other reviews. I believe highly rated properties should extend the brand to all rooms andor increase the negotiated price to ensure a positive experience.
Good. good restaurant and bar though a bit out of fashion these days. property is a bit tired needs a refresh.

Staying her while working. The location is perfect but at 080 this morning until “ I do n’t know when ” I was alarmed by banging and what sounds like a rotary hammer drill just above my head. I called the front desk to enquirer how long this would go and was informed it was part of a renovation and according to here “ I do n’t know till like 2019 ”. Ok I got it renovations are needed but no offer to change rooms or being compensated. Hell not even a “ sorry for the inconvenience ”. Tell me again what I ’m paying 500 bucks a night for other then to be kept awake. I work evenings. The hotel is nice enough and most staff have been great if you are looking for peace and quiet go to a park or something.

Mediocre at Best. Very nice staff. Room is so old with a lousy view of a building and no natural light not their fault it is a city after all. This may have been remedied if the room decor was n’t so old. Reminded me of a cruise ship cabin from the 80 ’s. They are renovating though which led to a prompt start of constant drilling at 9 am on the dot in the middle of a conference call that I had to take from the room. One positive room service breakfast was delicious. Not at all what I would expect from a W hotel. I was really looking forward to staying here and definitely disappointed. Hope the renovations help.
Amazing service and decor. The staff were always so helpful and the place was beautifully decorated and renovated.

Love this location. The location of this hotel is really great. A short walk to Chinatown or to the Ferry Building. The rooms are small but well laid out. The renovated rooms are nicely appointed. however there is no real place to put clothes other than leaving them in the suitcase. The breakfast offered are really good.

Decent stay but decor needs updating. We spent two nights at the W this past May and we had a decent stay at the W Service was overall OK and nothing special however the hotel is in dire need of a refresh. I have stayed in multiple W hotel over the years and this one really felt stale from a design perspective. Our room was poorly configured with furniture that aimed to look cool rather than be comfortable. The bar and restaurant downstairs felt sad too. I do not think we will come back to this hotel next time we are in San Francisco.
Very clean comfy beds renovated. Good location.
Staff was amazing and attentive. Great service at the front desk concierge and bar. Room was also updated and fun.

Great Experience. We stayed at this hotel last week for two nights in a newly renovated room. Everything was as expected at a W hotel friendly staff clean rooms good location especially if you are interested in the SF Museum of Modern Art and the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts. Had a DJ playing loud music in the bar before dinner this did not bother us as we expected it but it may not be your bag. The rooms are typically sized for downtown SF but quiet clean and newly renovated. I spoke with one of the managers Nico before my stay with a few questions and he was really helpful and friendly. Highly recommend this property and would stay again. IMO much better value than the nearby St Regis considering out needs.

Absolutely Fabulous. To be honest when reading some if the earlier reviews I was a little apprehensive to be staying at the W However when we walked through those doors my feelings completely changed. Welcomed as a friend by Antionete on the reception desk. We mentioned it was my partners Birthday when checking in. and Antionete very kindly gave us a voucher to use at the bar. Not only that once in the room she also sent us up a cupcake card and balloon. To say that is great service is an understatement. Antoinete if you are reading this Thank you so much for your friendly efficient and welcoming service. It was greatly appreciated. The room is absolutely fabulous on the 30th floor with a spectacular view of the town and mountains. The bathroom looks newly renovated and is gorgeous with a big shower and very clean. The bed is also one of the comfiest beds me and my partner have ever slept on. Every morning my partner has been going down to use the gym on the 4h floor. He said it is a winner with modern machines a clean layout and enough equiptment to actually have a proper work out. Everything is fairly close by. The main street Market is only about a 7 minute walk and from there you can either walk or get the F line towards the Castro or Fishermans Wharf 2 must see things here in SF. If paying with cash on the tram make sure you have the exact amount of 3 per ticket as they do nt give change. Also we found in San Francicso restaurants tend to close a lot earlier than the UK. So make sure you leave for dinner at around 830pm or risk having a limited choice of places to eat. Overall we have had a really great stay so Thank you W San Fran. We will.

Gorgeous hotel with stunning newly renovated rooms. I just got to see them tonight at the reopening party and they certainly do look great. The Ws location can not be beat right next to the convention center in the heart of SF. Staff was super friendly warm and just cool folks. W hotels are always quirky and cool and W SF is a great example of both.

I enjoyed the updates that they made to the bathroom room. Nice option to pay a slightly elevated price to have free valet parking. However inside the walls are thin and I could hear everything happening in the halls and in the room above me. Additionally the room I booked was to have a city view however upon arrival at the hotel they told me it would cost an additional 50 to have the city view I contracted for. I did not care to argue in the lobby and so I got to stare at a flat grey wall that is the side of another building as my view. Note if you use a debit card instead of a credit card they will withdraw 200 for potential incidentals from your account rather than just placing a hold. When i called they told me it would take 7 10 days to place the money back in my account.
Loved the location restaurant bar and room. Very clean modern and updated.
